Detailed Description

Class that defines a DAZ Studio plug-in.

This class provides startup and shutdown functionality for DAZ Studio plug-ins and maintains the list of class types exported by the plug-in. Each plug-in for DAZ Studio must provide a single instance of this class via the getPluginDefinition() function.

See DAZ Studio Plug-in Architecture for more information on creating plug-ins for DAZ Studio. See DAZ Studio Plug-in Macros for more information on macros to simplify creating plug-ins for DAZ Studio. See DAZ Studio Plug-in Activation and Serialization for more information on how to provide evaluation period and registration of plug-ins for DAZ Studio.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum DzPlugin::Status

Indicates the status of a plugin

Enumerator:
Loaded 

The plugin has been loaded

RequiresRestart 

DAZ Studio needs to be restarted before the plugin can be loaded

ManuallyDisabled 

The plugin has been disabled by the user

EvaluationInvalid 

The plugin evaluation period has expired

Failed 

The plugin failed to load

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzPlugin::DzPlugin ( const QString &  name,
const QString &  author = QString::null,
const QString &  description = QString::null,
unsigned short  major = 0,
unsigned short  minor = 0,
unsigned short  rev = 0,
unsigned short  build = 0 
)

Creates a new plug-in with the given description and version number. The version number will be divided into four places with one byte for each place. 2 places each for minor and semi-minor release numbers: e.g. 0x01020304 would result in the version number 1.2.3.4. Usually only called from the DZ_PLUGIN_DEFINITION() macro, or custom subclasses.

Parameters:
name The user-readable name for the plug-in.
author The plug-in author description
description A text paragraph that describes the plug-in.
major The plug-in major version.
minor The plug-in minor version.
rev The plug-in revision version.
build The plug-in build version.

Destructor.

void DzPlugin::addClassFactory ( DzClassFactory *  factory  ) 

Adds a class factory to the list of factories for this plug-in. Usually only called from the DZ_PLUGIN_CLASS_GUID() macro.

Parameters:
factory A pointer to the factory to add to the factories provided by this plug-in.

Parameters:

const QString &  description

Adds a registration prefix for the plug-in.

Parameters:

bool DzPlugin::isActivated (  )  const [slot]
See also:
isRegistered()
Returns:
True if the plug-in has been activated - meaning it has either been registered, or it is within an evaluation period.
bool DzPlugin::isRegistered (  )  const [slot]
See also:
isActivated()
Returns:
True if the plug-in has been registered. A plug-in is considered registered if the user has entered a valid serial number for it, and also if the plug-in does not use serial number registration. A plug-in that is just within an evaluation period is not considered registered.

Called by DzApp when the plug-in is loaded to register the io classes.

void DzPlugin::shutdown (  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by DzApp just before the plug-in is unloaded. Plug-ins can sub-class DzPlugin and override this function to implement custom behavior when they are unloaded.

void DzPlugin::startup (  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by DzApp when the plug-in is loaded (after setFileName() and before getFactories()). Plug-ins can sub-class DzPlugin and override this function to implement custom behavior when they are loaded.

bool DzPlugin::validateSerialNumber ( const QString &  serialNumber,
bool  saveIfValid 
) const [slot]
Parameters:
serialNumber The serial number to validate
saveIfValid Whether the serial number should be saved if it is found to be valid.
Returns:
True if the serial number is valid for the plug-in.
